Hi all,

I am trying to resize some space ship parts from the PX2 Wayland add on so I can have a bigger cargo bay that can hold way more things. I have read the CFG part in the wiki, yet when i change the "rescale = X" number ( I changed by x2 for all the parts of that mod) things dont seem to work out quite right. In the VAB/SPH all parts are size proportionate and fit together nicely, yet when i Launch the ship large gaps appear in between all the parts. Also the stabilizer fins seem to be way more powerful/ touchy than they were before. How do I edit the cfg file correctly to only make the model twice as big with all parts working correctly?

Thanks in advance
the new form is rescaleFactor = X

the new form is rescaleFactor = X

Thats is what I meant sorry. I did change that number, usually for the mod parts it was at 2, and i changed it to 4, i still got that problem though with the weird gaps that only appear when launching

I believe that Devo has made those parts to be compatible with MechJeb, and he had some issues with it wigging out on him and not working correctly if the parts collision meshes touched, so he gave everything a slight gap around all parts to prevent this. As you scale up the parts, the attach nodes that were set up to create those gaps also get scaled, meaning the gap gets bigger. I'm not sure on the control surfaces so I cannot help you there.

If you give me roughly the dimensions you want (ie give me stock part size and say "i want the PX-2 cockpit to be twice as big as an MK1 cockpit" ) if you can give me a description like that, I will edit the entire ship and upload a custom version for you. Everything for it is sitting right here, would not take me long.

The reason the rescaling does not work as intended is because all the parts were scaled up by 2 already, which in turn messed the original nodes up due to the size, which as Hooji said gave me issues with the joints. When you have alot of animations, the colliders for those animations can sometimes play havoc when they are animating. What doesn't collide when its open, is not the same as what collides when it's closed, and in the case of a cargo bay you want it to be a collider, but not convex so you can actually get stuff inside BUT it still needs a convex base so it doesnt fall through the floor. Anyway, sorry for the wal of text..

I am planning on a PX-3, so all the things I stuffed up on the PX-2 I will have fixed. It's about 80 percent done, I managed to make almost 3 entire craft in the time the forums were down
